interface.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Call.Content.MediaDescription.DRAFT
interface.tp:docstring: This object represents a remote Description Offer to which the local streaming implementation should reply with its local Description

method.name: Accept

arg.name: Local_Media_Description
arg.tp:docstring: The local description to send to the remote contacts and to use in the Content.DRAFT.

method.tp:docstring: Accepts the updated Description and update the corresponding local description.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.InvalidArgument
tp:error.tp:docstring: The decription given is invalid in some way.

method.name: Reject
method.tp:docstring: Reject the proposed update to the remote description FIXME add error codes and strings here

tp:docstring.p: Extra interfaces provided by this media description. This SHOULD NOT include the Description interface itself, and cannot change once the content has been created.

True if this offer contains information from the remote side: If False then the Accept response solely depends on the capabilities and preferences of the local side.
In most protocols this property will be False for the initial DescriptionOffer on an outgoing call.

This property will never be part of the DescriptionProperties used to describe this object. If this property is true then the DescriptionProperties describing this object will be empty (as there is no remote information to put in it)

property.name: RemoteCodecs
property.tp:docstring: A list of codecs the remote contact supports.

property.name: RemoteContact
property.tp:docstring:
The contact handle that this description applies to or 0 for a description that will apply to all remote contacts in the call.
[FIXME] the usage of 0 needs further clarifications

tp:docstring.p: A mapping containing all properties that define the information from a MediaDescription.DRAFT and its interfaces.
If HasRemoteInformation is False then this mapping will be empty otherwise it willl always contains at least RemoteCodecs
The HasRemoteInformation property is never part of this mapping.

tp:member.name: Media_Description_Property
tp:member.tp:docstring: A D-Bus interface name, followed by a dot and a D-Bus property name.
